tit.e: Kushiki-ryo (the law concerning documentary forms of state affairs, contained in the Yoro Code) (a part of the Ritsuryo law system)
Kushiki-ryo (the law concerning documentary forms of state affairs, contained in the Yoro Code) (a part of the Ritsuryo law system)

sen.j: 公式令（くしきりょう）は、令におけるおける編目の1つ。
sen.e: "Kushiki-ryo" was one of compilations of ryo (administrative laws in the Ritsuryo law system).
"Kushiki-ryo" was one of compilations of ryo (administrative laws in the Ritsuryo law system).

sen.j: 公文書・法令の様式及び施行規則を定める。
sen.e: It specified various forms of official documents and enforcement regulations of laws and ordinances..
It specified various forms of official documents and enforcement regulations of laws and ordinances..

sen.j: 日本の養老律令では第21番目に位置して89条から構成されている。
sen.e: This Kushiki-ryo, consisting of eighty-nine articles, was set forth in the 21st section of the Yoro Ristsuryo Code of Japan.
This Kushiki-ryo, consisting of eighty-nine articles, was set forth in the 21st section of the Yoro Ristsuryo Code of Japan.

sen.j: 同名の令は隋や唐の律令にも見られる。
sen.e: There existed other ryo (administrative laws) of the same name in the Ritsuryo law system of the Sui and Tang dynasties in China.
There existed other ryo (administrative laws) of the same name in the Ritsuryo law system of the Sui and Tang dynasties in China.
There existed other ryo (administrative laws) of the same name in the Ritsuryo law system of the Sui and Tang dynasties in China.

sen.j: 日本の律令法においては、最も古くから存在した規定の1つと考えられている。
sen.e: In the Japanese Ritsuryo law system, the Kushiki-ryo law was one of the oldest rules and regulations existed in Japan, as it has been so believed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Japanese Ritsuryo law system, the Kushiki-ryo law was one of the oldest rules and regulations existed in Japan, as it has been so believed.

sen.j: 養老令では最大の条文数を数えている。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Kushiki-ryo had the highest number of provisions of all the laws in the Yoro-ryo.

sen.j: 養老令においては、
sen.e: As a part of the Yoro-ryo (Yoro Code), the Kushiki-ryo law contained the following specific Articles:

sen.j: 詔書式（詔書の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Shosho-siki" (forms of imperial rescript) was put here to specify documentary forms of shosho (imperial rescript).
This Article "Shosho-siki" (forms of imperial rescript) was put here to specify documentary forms of shosho (imperial rescript).
This Article "Shosho-siki" (forms of imperial rescript) was put here to specify documentary forms of shosho (imperial rescript).

sen.j: 勅旨式（勅旨の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Chokushi-shiki" (forms of imperial order) was put here to specify documentary forms of chokushi (imperial order).
This Article "Chokushi-shiki" (forms of imperial order) was put here to specify documentary forms of chokushi (imperial order).
This Article "Chokushi-shiki" (forms of imperial order) was put here to specify documentary forms of chokushi (imperial order).

sen.j: 論奏式（太政官が発議・決定した事項に対して、天皇に裁可を求める際の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Ronso-shiki" was put here to specify various documentary forms to seek imperial ratification of affairs proposed and decided by Daijo-kan, the Grand Council of State.
This Article "Ronso-shiki" was put here to specify various documentary forms to seek imperial ratification of affairs proposed and decided by Daijo-kan, the Grand Council of State.

sen.j: 奏事式（諸司から出された解 (公文書)の事項に対して、天皇に裁可を求める際の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Soji-shiki" was put here to specify some documentary forms to seek imperial ratification of affairs described in a letter called "ge" (a type of official document) submitted by shoshi (various officials).

This Article "Soji-shiki" was put here to specify some documentary forms to seek imperial ratification of affairs described in a letter called "ge" (a type of official document) submitted by shoshi (various officials).

This Article "Soji-shiki" was put here to specify some documentary forms to seek imperial ratification of affairs described in a letter called "ge" (a type of official document) submitted by shoshi (various officials).

sen.j: 便奏式（少納言から提出された日常の政務及び宮中の雑務に対して、天皇に裁可を求める際の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Binso-shiki" was put here to specify some documentary forms to seek imperial approval for daily governmental affairs and miscellaneous business in the imperial court, submitted by Shonagon (lesser councilor of state).

This Article "Binso-shiki" was put here to specify some documentary forms to seek imperial approval for daily governmental affairs and miscellaneous business in the imperial court, submitted by Shonagon (lesser councilor of state).

sen.j: 令旨式（皇太子・三后が出す令旨の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Ryoji-shiki" was put here to specify documentary forms to announce such orders as of Kotaishi (Crown Prince) and Sanko (grand mother, mother and legitimate consort of the Emperor).
This Article "Ryoji-shiki" was put here to specify documentary forms to announce such orders as of Kotaishi (Crown Prince) and Sanko (grand mother, mother and legitimate consort of the Emperor).

sen.j: 啓式（春宮坊（中宮職）が決定した事項に対して、皇太子（三后）に裁可を求める際の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Kei-shiki" was put here to specify documentary forms to seek approval of Kotaishi (Crown Prince) and Sanko (Emperor's grand mother, mother and legitimate consort) for the affairs decided by Togubo (Crown Prince's quarters) or Chugu-shiki (imperial offices for Sanko (Emperor's grand mother, mother and legitimate consort).

sen.j: 奏弾式（弾正台が皇族・官人の犯罪を天皇に対して告発する際の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Sodan-shiki" was put here to specify documentary forms in which Danjodai (Board of Censors) could accuse some imperial family members and government officials toward the Emperor.

This Article "Sodan-shiki" was put here to specify documentary forms in which Danjodai (Board of Censors) could accuse some imperial family members and government officials of crime toward the Emperor.

sen.j: 飛駅式〔下式〕（勅命を地方官に下す際の副状の書式）
sen.e: The Article "Hieki-shiki (Shimo-shiki)" was put here to specify documentary forms of accompanying letters attached to any imperial order to be handed down to local officers.
The Article "Hieki-shiki (Shimo-shiki)" was put here to specify documentary forms of accompanying letters attached to any imperial order to be handed down to local officers.

sen.j: 飛駅式〔上式〕（地方官が上奏を行う際の副状の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Hieki-shiki (Kami-shiki)" was put here to specify documentary forms of accompanying letters written by local officers and submitted to their superiors in Kyoto.

sen.j: 解式（解（下級官司より所属の上級官司へ）の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Ge-shiki" was put here to specify documentary forms of official documents called "ge" that were submitted by lower-ranked governmental officials to their superiors.
This Article "Ge-shiki" was put here to specify documentary forms of official documents called "ge" that were submitted by lower-ranked governmental officials to their superiors.

sen.j: 移式（移（統属関係にない官司同士間）の書式）
sen.e: This Article "I-shiki" was put here to specify documentary forms of official documents called "i" that were exchanged between offices without hierarchical relationship.

sen.j: 符式（符（上級官司より所管の下級官司へ）の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Fu-shiki" was put here to specify documentary forms of official documents called "fu" that were written by superior officers to lower officials.

sen.j: 牒式（牒（主典以上の官人個人より官司へ）の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Cho-shiki" was put here to specify documentary forms of a personal letter written by an officer called "cho" who was ranked higher than sakan.class, addressed to any other officer.
This Article "Cho-shiki" was put here to specify documentary forms of a personal letter called "cho", which was written by an officer who was ranked higher than sakan class to any other officer.
sen.cmt: choは官人の呼び名ではなく、文書の呼び名なので、左記のように修正しました。

sen.j: 辞式（辞（雑任以下庶人より官司へ）の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Ji-shiki" was put here to specify forms of documents called "ji" that were written by lower-ranked officials or ordinary people and submitted to any government official.

sen.j: 勅授位記式条（五位以上の位記の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Chokuju-iki-shikijo" (a statutory law concerning imperial investiture) was put here to specify documentary forms for bestowal of ranks higher than goi (the Fifth Rank).
This Article "Chokuju-iki-shikijo" (a statutory law concerning imperial investiture) was put here to specify documentary forms for bestowal of ranks higher than goi (the Fifth Rank).

sen.j: 奏授位記式条（八位（内位のみ）以上の六位以下の位記の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Soju-iki-shikijo" (a statutory law concerning a kind of investiture called "soju" that was first proposed by ministers and finally approved by the Emperor) was put here to specify documentary forms for bestowing court ranks lower than rokui (the Sixth Rank) but higher than hachii (the Eighth Rank) within the category of "nai-i."

sen.j: 判授位記式条（八位（外位のみ）及び初位の位記の書式）
sen.e: This Article "Hanju-iki-shikijo" (a staturoty law concerning a kind of investiture called "hanju") was put here to specify the documentary form of a letter of investiture called "hanju" that was bestowed by Daijokan (the Grand Council of State) to officials of hachii (the Eighth Rank) within the category of "gai-i" and to the officials of shoi (the Initial Rank).

sen.j: 闕字（公文書において用いる際に一字分空白を設けなければならない語句）
sen.e: In this Article, the term "Ketsuji" meant another type of special wording which had always to be put behind one letter space in any official documents.

sen.j: 汎説古事（平出・闕字の対象外とされる例（一般的な文中における用句及び日本以外の事例））
sen.e: This Article was put here to explain that hansetsu-koji (well-known ancient affairs) were excluded from the category of heishutsu and ketsuji, in the same manner as the phrases used in ordinary sentences and such cases as happened outside of Japan.

sen.j: 天子神璽（神璽・玉璽・太政官印などの公印）
sen.e: This Article was put here to identify "Tenshi no Jinji" (Emperor's sacred emblems) with Jinji (a sacred jewel), Gyokuji (an imperial seal), and some official seals including the seal of Daijokan (the Grand Council of State).

sen.j: 行公文皆印（公文書への押印の位置）
sen.e: While all official documents had to be sealed, proper positions to be sealed on the documents were determined in this Article.
While all official documents had to be sealed, proper positions to be sealed on the documents were determined in this Article.
While all official documents had to be sealed, proper positions to be sealed on the documents were determined in this Article.

sen.j: 給駅伝馬（公的使節の移動に関する駅馬・伝馬）
sen.e: Supply of ekiba and tenma (horses for transportation of official missions and posts) were referred to in this Article.
Supply of ekiba and tenma (horses for transportation of official missions and posts) were referred to in this Article.
Supply of ekiba and tenma (horses for transportation of official missions and posts) were referred to in this Article.

sen.j: 諸国給鈴（諸国国府に配備される駅鈴）
sen.e: This Article was put here to explain about ekirei (certificates of qualification to use ekiba and tenma) which were allotted to each provincial capital.
This Article was put here to explain about ekirei (certificates of qualification to use ekiba and tenma) which were allotted to each provincial capital.
This Article was put here to explain about ekirei (certificates of qualification to use ekiba and tenma) which were allotted to each provincial capital.

sen.j: 車駕巡幸（行幸時に留守官が預かる駅鈴などの扱い）
sen.e: This article "Shaga Junko" was put here to provide terms and conditions to be observed by officials in charge of guarding imperial palaces while the Emperor was on a trip, including proper treatment of ekirei.

This article "Shaga Junko" was put here to provide terms and conditions to be observed by officials in charge of guarding imperial palaces while the Emperor was on a trip, including proper treatment of ekirei.

sen.j: 給随身符（随身符と呼ばれる非常時の通行証の扱い）
sen.e: This Article "Kyu-zuishinpu" (supply of a tally or pass for a traveller to be carried on the body) provided conditions to issue or treat such tally or pass on an emergency case.
This Article "Kyu-zuishinpu" (supply of a tally or pass for a traveller to be carried on the body) provided conditions to issue or treat such tally or pass on an emergency case.
This Article "Kyu-zuishinpu" (supply of a tally or pass for a traveller to be carried on the body) provided conditions to issue or treat such tally or pass on an emergency case.

sen.j: 国有急速（緊急時に令制国間で使者を発した場合の太政官への事後報告）
sen.e: This Article "Kokuyu-kyusoku" required reports to Daijokan (the Grand Council of State) after the fact of provincial emergencies, when emergent envoys were exchanged between some provinces under Ritsuryo system.

This Article "Kokuyu-kyusoku" required reports to Daijokan (the Grand Council of State) after the fact of provincial emergencies, when emergent envoys were exchanged between some provinces under Ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 国司使人（国司が解を持った使者を派遣する際の規定）
sen.e: This Article "Kokushi-shijin" (envoys of provincial governors) provided rules and regulations for a provincial governor to dispatch an envoy carrying a message called "ge" from a lower-ranked official to his superior.

This Article "Kokushi-shijin" (envoys of provincial governors) provided rules and regulations for a provincial governor to dispatch an envoy carrying a message called "ge" from a lower-ranked official to his superior.

sen.j: 在京諸司（在京諸司の官人が駅馬を利用する際の規定）
sen.e: This Article "Zaikyo-shoshi" (officials staying in Kyoto) described rules and regulations for government officials staying in Kyoto to use ekiba (horses to carry official travellers.
This Article "Zaikyo-shoshi" (officials staying in Kyoto) described rules and regulations for government officials staying in Kyoto to use ekiba (horses to carry official travellers.)

sen.j: 駅使在路（駅馬で移動中の使者が急病等のトラブルに遭遇した際の規定）
sen.e: This Article "Ekishi-zairo" (envoys on the road) stipulated provisions on how to deal with the case of an envoy who encountered with any trouble including sudden sickness while he was on his duty using ekiba (a horse for transportation of officer).

This Article "Ekishi-zairo" (envoys on the road) stipulated provisions on how to deal with the case of an envoy who encountered with any trouble including sudden sickness while he was on his duty using ekiba (a horse for transportation of officer).

sen.j: 国有瑞（諸国が駅馬を発して中央に緊急報告すべき事例）
sen.e: This Article "Kokuyuzui" indicated case examples that any province had to report urgently to central government on their auspicious events by dispatching ekiba (horses for transportation of officials).
sen.cmt: 「国有瑞」の意味・読み方不明。
sen.e: This Article "Kokuyuzui" indicated case examples that any province had to report urgently to central government on their auspicious events by dispatching ekiba (horses for transportation of officials).

This Article "Kokuyuzui" indicated case examples that any province had to report urgently to central government on their auspicious events by dispatching ekiba (horses for transportation of officials).

sen.j: 朝集使（中央に召集された国司の駅馬利用規定）
sen.e: This Article "Choshushi" (clerks conveying official documents made under the Ritsuryo System) provided rules and regulations on use of ekiba (horses to transport officials) by provincial governers who were summoned to the central government office.

This Article "Choshushi" (clerks conveying official documents made under the Ritsuryo System) provided rules and regulations on use of ekiba (horses to transport officials) by provincial governors who were summoned to the central government office.
sen.cmt: governersのスペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: This Article "Choshushi" (clerks conveying official documents made under the Ritsuryo System) provided rules and regulations on use of ekiba (horses to transport officials) by provincial governors who were summoned to the central government office.

sen.j: 内外諸司（職事官・散官及び文官・武官の区別）
sen.e: This Article "Naige-shoshi" (officials in charge of various affairs inside and outside of Kyoto) was put here to distinguish Shikijikan (a person with both an officcial rank and corresponding role) from Sankan (a person with an official rank but no corresponding role) and also Bunkan (civil officer) from Bukan (military officer).

This Article "Naige-shoshi" (officials in charge of various affairs inside and outside of Kyoto) was put here to distinguish Shikijikan (a person with both an official rank and corresponding role) from Sankan (a person with an official rank but no corresponding role) and also Bunkan (civil officer) from Bukan (military officer).
sen.cmt: officcialのスペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: This Article "Naige-shoshi" (officials in charge of various affairs inside and outside of Kyoto) was put here to distinguish Shikijikan (a person with both an official rank and corresponding role) from Sankan (a person with an official rank but no corresponding role) and also Bunkan (civil officer) from Bukan (military officer).

sen.j: 京官（京官・外官（地方官）の区別）
sen.e: This Article "Kyokan" (officials staying in Kyoto) indicated distinction between kyokan (an official staying in Kyoto) and gekan (a local government official).
This Article "Kyokan" (officials staying in Kyoto) indicated distinction between kyokan (an official staying in Kyoto) and gekan (a local government official).
This Article "Kyokan" (officials staying in Kyoto) indicated distinction between kyokan (an official staying in Kyoto) and gekan (a local government official).

sen.j: 品位応叙（位階の通則）
sen.e: This Article "Honi-ojo" (court ranks given through investiture) provided general rules about court ranking.
This Article "Honi-ojo" (court ranks given through investiture) provided general rules about court ranking.
This Article "Honi-ojo" (court ranks given through investiture) provided general rules about court ranking.

sen.j: 文武職事（宮中行事における席次）
sen.e: This Article "Bunbu-shikiji" (civil officers, military officers, Shikijikan and Sankan) was put here to specify a seating order of attendants at any imperial event.
This Article "Bunbu-shikiji" (civil officers, military officers, Shikijikan and Sankan) was put here to specify a seating order of attendants at any imperial event.
This Article "Bunbu-shikiji" (civil officers, military officers, Shikijikan and Sankan) was put here to specify a seating order of attendants at any imperial event.

sen.j: 諸王五位（官職を致仕した皇族・官人への待遇）
sen.e: This Article "Shoo-goi" (princes without imperial proclamation and the Fifth Rank) described conditions to treat imperial families and government officials who retired at his age-limit from government post.

This Article "Shoo-goi" (princes without imperial proclamation and the Fifth Rank) described conditions to treat imperial families and government officials who retired at the age-limit from government posts.
sen.cmt: government postを主語に合わせて複数にしました。
sen.e: This Article "Shoo-goi" (princes without imperial proclamation and the Fifth Rank) described conditions to treat imperial families and government officials who retired at the age-limit from government posts.

sen.j: 弾正別勅（弾正台の官人が他の官司の職務を兼ねる場合、当該官司への監察行為の禁止）
sen.e: This Article "Danjo-betsuchoku" prohibited officials of Danjo-dai (the Board of Censors) from acts of supervision or inspection of any other government official whose job, if any, he was engaged in beside his main job.
sen.cmt: 「弾正別勅」の意味・読み方不明。
sen.e: This Article "Danjo-betsuchoku" prohibited officials of Danjo-dai (the Board of Censors) from acts of supervision or inspection of any other government official whose job, if any, he was engaged in beside his main job.

sen.j: 内外官（ある官司の官人が他の官司の職務を兼ねる場合の身分規定）
sen.e: This Article "Naige-kan" (government officials staying inside and outside of Kyoto) prescribed status of a government official who is engaged in two different jobs of different officers.
This Article "Naige-kan" (government officials staying inside and outside of Kyoto) prescribed status of a government official who is engaged in two different jobs of different officers.
This Article "Naige-kan" (government officials staying inside and outside of Kyoto) prescribed status of a government official who is engaged in two different jobs of different officers.

sen.j: 百官宿直（宿直に関する規定）
sen.e: This Article "Hyakkan-shukuchoku" (every official on a night duty) stipulated rules and regulations on performing night watch duty by an official.
This Article "Hyakkan-shukuchoku" (every official on a night duty) stipulated rules and regulations on performing night watch duty by an official.
This Article "Hyakkan-shukuchoku" (every official on a night duty) stipulated rules and regulations on performing night watch duty by an official.

sen.j: 京官上下（京官の勤務時間の規定）
sen.e: This Article "Kyokan-joge" (officials in Kyoto, calling on and leaving from the imperial court) specified their service hours to attend the court.
This Article "Kyokan-joge" (officials in Kyoto, calling on and leaving from the imperial court) specified their service hours to attend the court.
This Article "Kyokan-joge" (officials in Kyoto, calling on and leaving from the imperial court) specified their service hours to attend the court.

sen.j: 詔勅（假の取消を命じる事が可能な事例）
sen.e: This Article "Shochoku" (imperial rescript) was put here to mention about some case examples that allowed to command cancellation of leaves of any official.
This Article "Shochoku" (imperial rescript) was put here to mention about some case examples that allowed to command cancellation of leaves of any official.
This Article "Shochoku" (imperial rescript) was put here to mention about some case examples that allowed to command cancellation of leaves of any official.

sen.j: 受時（政務に関する事務処理の期限）
sen.e: This Article "Juji" (receiving time) specified time limits for clerks to finish their paperwork on government affairs.
This Article "Juji" (receiving time) specified time limits for clerks to finish their paperwork on government affairs.

sen.e: Suit (judicial procedure):

sen.j: 訴訟追摂（召喚に応じない訴訟当事者に対する措置）
sen.e: This Article sosho-tsuisetsu indicated some methods to deal with litigant party who denies to answer a summons)
This Article sosho-tsuisetsu indicated some methods to deal with a litigant party who denies to answer a summons)
sen.cmt: litigant partyの前にaを加えました。

sen.j: 陳意見（意見封事に関する規定）
sen.e: This Article "Chin-iken" (expression of opinion) set forth rules and regulations on preparing a letter of opinion in response to Emperor's inquiry, that would be enclosed in hermetically closed envelope and addressed direct to the Emperor.

This Article "Chin-iken" (expression of opinion) set forth rules and regulations on preparing a letter of opinion in response to Emperor's inquiry, that would be enclosed in hermetically closed envelope and addressed direct to the Emperor.

This Article "Chin-iken" (expression of opinion) set forth rules and regulations on preparing a letter of opinion in response to Emperor's inquiry, that would be enclosed in hermetically closed envelope and addressed direct to the Emperor.

sen.j: 公文（公文書に用いる字体（楷書・大字 (数字)））
sen.e: This Article "Kumon" (official documents) was to indicate particular styles of characters written in any official letter or document, such as kaisho (block script), omoji (capital letters) and other styles including numeric characters.

This Article "Kumon" (official documents) was to indicate particular styles of characters written in any official letter or document, such as kaisho (block script), omoji (capital letters) and other styles including numeric characters.

This Article "Kumon" (official documents) was to indicate particular styles of characters written in any official letter or document, such as kaisho (block script), omoji (capital letters) and other styles including numeric characters.

sen.j: 料給官物（官物支給手続）
sen.e: This Article "Ryokyu-kanmotsu" specified procedures to distribute the tributes that had been paid as taxes and tithes to the government.
sen.cmt: 「料給官物」の意味・読み方不明。
sen.e: This Article "Ryokyu-kanmotsu" specified procedures to distribute the tributes that had been paid as taxes and tithes to the government.
This Article "Ryokyu-kanmotsu" specified procedures to distribute the tributes that had been paid as taxes and tithes to the government.

sen.j: 授位任官/喚辞（官人の名前を呼ぶ場合の作法）
sen.e: This Article "Jui-ninkan/Kanji" (bestowal of ranks and appointment of posts/calls of names) set forth manners in which names of the government officers were called.
This Article "Jui-ninkan/Kanji" (bestowal of ranks and appointment of posts/calls of names) set forth manners in which names of the government officers were called.
This Article "Jui-ninkan/Kanji" (bestowal of ranks and appointment of posts/calls of names) set forth manners in which names of the government officers were called.

sen.j: 奉詔勅（詔勅などの施行段階において重大な瑕疵が明らかとなった場合）
sen.e: This Article "Hoshochoku" (to report to the throne about once announced imperial rescript) was provided to explain about the cases where some grave defects were found in the original rescript at the stage of its enforcement).

This Article "Hoshochoku" (to report to the throne about once announced imperial rescript) was provided to explain about the cases where some grave defects were found in the original rescript at the stage of its enforcement).

sen.j: 駅使至京（駅使着京と蕃人帰化に関する規定）
sen.e: This Article "Ekishi-shikyo" (envoy's arrival in Kyoto) was made to set forth rules and regulations concerning envoys who had returned to Kyoto as well as savages who had become naturalized Japanese citizens.

This Article "Ekishi-shikyo" (envoy's arrival in Kyoto) was made to set forth rules and regulations concerning envoys who had returned to Kyoto as well as savages who had become naturalized Japanese citizens.

This Article "Ekishi-shikyo" (envoy's arrival in Kyoto) was made to set forth rules and regulations concerning envoys who had returned to Kyoto as well as savages who had become naturalized Japanese citizens.

sen.j: 諸司受勅（勅旨を中務省を経ずに、天皇より直接受けた官司・官人の対応方法についての規定）
sen.e: This Article "Shoshi-juchoku" (officials who received imperial orders directly from the Emperor) was written to set forth rules and regulations on corresponding methods to be taken by government officials who received imperial orders directly from the Emperor, not through the Ministry of Central Affairs.

This Article "Shoshi-juchoku" (officials who received imperial orders directly from the Emperor) was written to set forth rules and regulations on corresponding methods to be taken by government officials who received imperial orders directly from the Emperor, not through the Ministry of Central Affairs.

sen.j: 事有急速（緊急時の勅旨発令）
sen.e: This Article "Jiyukyusoku" (urgent matters) was made to explain about the issue of imperial orders in the case of emergency.
This Article "Jiyukyusoku" (urgent matters) was made to explain about the issue of imperial orders in the case of emergency.
This Article "Jiyukyusoku" (urgent matters) was made to explain about the issue of imperial orders in the case of emergency.

sen.j: 官人判事（官人が自分が行った事務処理の誤りに気付いた場合）
sen.e: This Article "Kanjin-hanji" (a government official becoming aware of his own mistakes) was made to refer to the case that any government official became aware of his own clerical mistakes.
This Article "Kanjin-hanji" (a government official becoming aware of his own mistakes) was made to refer to the case that any government official became aware of his own clerical mistakes.
This Article "Kanjin-hanji" (a government official becoming aware of his own mistakes) was made to refer to the case that any government official became aware of his own clerical mistakes.

sen.j: 詔勅宣行（詔勅の施行段階で誤字・脱字が発見された場合）
sen.e: This Article "Shochoku-sengyo" (an official's act to scrutinize imperial rescript before sending it to Daijokan (the Grand Councilor of State) was made to refer to the case that any omissions or errors were found in the rescript at the stage of its enforcement.

This Article "Shochoku-sengyo" (an official's act to scrutinize imperial rescript before sending it to Daijokan [the Grand Councilor of State]) was made to refer to the case that any omissions or errors were found in the rescript at the stage of its enforcement.
sen.cmt: was madeの前に）を加えました。また、the Grand Councilor of Stateの前後の括弧を変更しました。

sen.j: 詔勅頒行（町村の庶人に詔勅を告示する際の手続）
sen.e: This Article "Shochoku-hanko" (an act of making imperial rescript publicly known and practiced) was made to describe procedures for notifying the rescript to the common people in local towns and villages).

This Article "Shochoku-hanko" (an act of making imperial rescript publicly known and practiced) was made to describe procedures for notifying the rescript to the common people in local towns and villages).

sen.j: 下司申解（上申文書・下達文書における不備が明らかとなった場合）
sen.e: This Article "Geshi-shinkai" (a petition from a lower-ranking official) was made to refer to the case that any defect was found in a statement submitted to a superior officer or in a description given to a lower-ranking official.

This Article "Geshi-shinkai" (a petition from a lower-ranking official) was made to refer to the case that any defect was found in a statement submitted to a superior officer or in a description given to a lower-ranking official.

sen.j: 諸司奏事（太政官を経ずに、諸司から天皇に直接上奏が行われる場合）
sen.e: This Article "Shoshi-soji" (petitions of officials) was made to refer to the cases that allowed any official to submit his description direct to the Emperor not through Daijokan.
This Article "Shoshi-soji" (petitions of officials) was made to refer to the cases that allowed any official to submit his description direct to the Emperor not through Daijokan.

sen.j: 須責保（保人（公的分野における連帯保証人）の規定）
sen.e: This Article "Syusekiho" was made to indicate rules and regulations concerned to honin (joint and several guarantor in the public sector).
sen.cmt: 「須責保」の意味・読み方ともに不明
sen.e: This Article "Syusekiho" was made to indicate rules and regulations concerned to honin (joint and several guarantor in the public sector).

sen.j: 受勅出使（勅使の任務規定）
sen.e: This Article "Juchoku-shusshi" (an outgoing envoy conveying an imperial rescript he had received direct from the Emperor) was made to set forth rules and regulations concerning duties of such imperial envoy.

This Article "Juchoku-shusshi" (an outgoing envoy conveying an imperial rescript he had received direct from the Emperor) was made to set forth rules and regulations concerning duties of such imperial envoy.

sen.j: 京官出使（京官が使者として出発・帰京する際の手続、公文書の地方への送付方法）
sen.e: This Article "Kyokan-shusshi" (an outgoing envoy from Kyoto) was made to specify procedures for an official in Kyoto to follow when he was to leave Kyoto as an envoy and when he returned to Kyoto from his trip, as well as such methods as to send off official documents to the provinces)

This Article "Kyokan-shusshi" (an outgoing envoy from Kyoto) was made to specify procedures for an official in Kyoto to follow when he was to leave Kyoto as an envoy and when he returned to Kyoto from his trip, as well as such methods as to send off official documents to the provinces)

sen.j: 責返抄（諸司への返抄に関する規定）
sen.e: This Article "Seki-hensho" was made to indicate rules and regulations regarding hensho (a report which each envoy was required to make and submit to his superior in Kyoto on the performance of his duties).
sen.cmt: 「責返抄」の意味・読み方不明。

sen.j: 案成（公文書の案文の保管・収蔵及び目録作成義務）
sen.e: This Article "Annari" was made to specify the duty to reserve and store drafts of the official documents and to make them listed).
This Article "Annari" was made to specify the duty to reserve and store drafts of the official documents and to make them listed).

sen.j: 文案（公文書の保管期間規定）
sen.e: This Articlle "Bun-an" was made to specify storage periods of official documents.

sen.cmt: Articlleのスペルミスを修正しました。

sen.j: 任授官位（官位任命に関する名簿作成規定）
sen.e: This Article "Ninju-kani" (bestowal of court ranks) was made to describe an obligation to make a list of names and ranks concerned)
This Article "Ninju-kani" (bestowal of court ranks) was made to describe an obligation to make a list of names and ranks concerned)

sen.j: 授位校勲（授位・校勲の天皇への奏上手続）
sen.e: This Article "Jui-kokun" (bestowal of court ranks and conferment of orders) was made to describe procedures to submit a report to the Emperor on bestowal of court ranks and conferment of orders.
This Article "Jui-kokun" (bestowal of court ranks and conferment of orders) was made to describe procedures to submit a report to the Emperor on bestowal of court ranks and conferment of orders.

sen.j: 官人父母（官人の父母が重病な時に使者として遠方への派遣の禁止）
sen.e: This Article "Kanjin-fubo" (parents of an official) was made to prohibit dispatch of any government official as an envoy to a distant place when his parents were severely ill.
This Article "Kanjin-fubo" (parents of an official) was made to prohibit dispatch of any government official as an envoy to a distant place when his parents were severely ill.
This Article "Kanjin-fubo" (parents of an official) was made to prohibit dispatch of any government official as an envoy to a distant place when his parents were severely ill.

sen.j: 外官赴任（外官赴任時の家族の随行規制）
sen.e: This Article "Gekan-funin" (assumption of a new post as a local government official) was made to regulate accompanying family of an officer when he was starting a new job as a local government official.

This Article "Gekan-funin" (assumption of a new post as a local government official) was made to regulate accompanying family of an officer when he was starting a new job as a local government official.

This Article "Gekan-funin" (assumption of a new post as a local government official) was made to regulate accompanying family of an officer when he was starting a new job as a local government official.

sen.j: 行程（1日の標準行程）
sen.e: This Article "Kotei" (tour distance) was made to indicate a standard tour distance per day.
This Article "Kotei" (tour distance) was made to indicate a standard tour distance per day.
This Article "Kotei" (tour distance) was made to indicate a standard tour distance per day.

sen.j: 遠方殊俗（化外人（日本人以外の外国人）が来訪した場合の対応規定）
sen.e: This Article "Enpo-shuzoku" (strange customs in a distant country) was made to specify conditions to deal with the visit of foreigners to Japan.
This Article "Enpo-shuzoku" (strange customs in a distant country) was made to specify conditions to deal with the visit of foreigners to Japan.
This Article "Enpo-shuzoku" (strange customs in a distant country) was made to specify conditions to deal with the visit of foreigners to Japan.

sen.j: という構成となっており、政府運営の基礎となる公文書・法令の規定のみならず、それを扱う官人の服務規程や訴訟手続などをも含む。
sen.e: Thus, the law Kushiki-ryo was made up of the above mentioned Articles, which covered not only rules and regulations on official documents and laws and ordinances that underpinned the management of then government, but also service regulations for government officials in charge of the said rules and regulations, as well as judicial procedures.

Thus, the law Kushiki-ryo was made up of the above mentioned Articles, which covered not only rules and regulations on official documents and laws and ordinances that underpinned the management of then government, but also service regulations for government officials in charge of the said rules and regulations, as well as judicial procedures.

Thus, the law Kushiki-ryo was made up of the above mentioned Articles, which covered not only rules and regulations on official documents and laws and ordinances that underpinned the management of then government, but also service regulations for government officials in charge of the said rules and regulations, as well as judicial procedures.
